intro: Guatteriella tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly guatteria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators.
